channel.title: Making my client take less space
channel.description:
So, my client's about 60MB when Zipped, and 120MB when not.
I'm just wondering as you see hundreds of servers ; you download their package, run a .bat and it opens a .jar which is only about 300KB big. ( or so, can be upto 5MB. ) But how do i get my client to be like that? I've jarred+signed, no use. I need a good tutorial / helping hand. Thanks alot.

item.title: Making my client take less space
item.dc:creator: @luka186 luka186
item.description:
@luka186 wrote:

any small tutorial? i got a little bit but i needa know how to apply it ;s

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

^ Plus you will need to initialize it in the client class.

item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

luka186:

yeah i got that but how do i do it? like how, not why lol

Rip a CacheDownloader class from a PI client.

item.title: Making my client take less space
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Those clients with automatic cache downloaders load the cache separately. Anything higher than 317 will have pretty large cache sizes.

Read full topic
